snippet: Carlos Carromero, who served time in prison after pleading guilty to attempted murder in the 1984 shooting of John Pugh, faces a new charge — this time a murder count — over the same shooting.
abstract: Carlos Carromero, who served nearly decade in prison for 1984 shooting in Bronx that paralyzed John Pugh, faces murder charge after Pugh dies of what medical examiner deems to be complications stemming from injury; Carromero was released in 1995 after serving sentence for original charge.
lead_paragraph: Carlos Carromero, who served time in prison after pleading guilty to attempted murder in the 1984 shooting of John Pugh, faces a new charge — this time a murder count — over the same shooting.

headline.main: With Death, ’84 Shooting Brings New Charge
headline.print_headline: With Death, ’84 Shooting Brings New Charge
